title: Who was Donato and why does he want all the blame over his teachings to be shared with other intellectuals?
first_phrase: In the earlier part of the text, Donato speaks about his abilities as a spiritualist and criticizes those who mock him. In contrast, the last 200 tokens provide a summary of the conclusion of the Revue Spirite, a publication about spiritualism. The article argues in favor of Donato, attributing his success as a speaker to his intelligence, education, and marriage to a woman from a literate family. The article claims that Donato’s arguments are not only effective but also supported by his ability to draw large audiences and collect substantial revenue from his public presentations. The author also argues that exploiting his talent and intelligence is not dishonorable but merely human, and suggests that Donato's success can be emulated rather than criticized. The text mentions several other well-known individuals in the literary and scientific world who are also engaged in public presentations.
content: 2° Pauvre, ne sachant rien organiser, Donato traînant la loque eût été méprisé, délaissé, son action eût été nulle. 3° Donato étant instruit, intelligent, distingué, pouvant discuter avec- les hommes de science et s’en faire écouter, attire les hommes et les femmes des hautes classes de la société ; ayant ■ su économiser, marié à une jeune et belle femme bien élevée et appartenant à une famille de lettrés, Donato entoure sa compagne de confort, lui donne le prestige exigé par le public qu’il reçoit chez lui et avec lequel il peut marcher de pair, toutes causes d’influences extérieures qui secondent admirablement l’enseignement qu’il donne. 4° En conséquence, les moyens qu’il emploie étant honnêtes, honorables, acceptés, nous ne pouvons qu’applaudir à ses succès ; chacun est parfaitement libre de l’envier, de le jalouser, de le décrier, ce qui est humain, mais il serait plus rationnel de prouver, par le fait brutal, que sans un spectacle organisé, avec un vêtement délabré, sans la forme en un mot, on peut être non plus expert mais seulement l’égal de Donato.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the success of Donato in the field of mesmerism is a result of not only his intelligence and knowledge but also his ability to organize and present himself in a respectable manner. It is a reminder that even the most skilled individuals require a certain level of presentation to gain influence, and with practice and education, anyone can achieve similar success.
